alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 11:42AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM CONTINUES... .Heavy snow is beginning to wind down as center of low pressure moves east into the northwest Atlantic. The heaviest snowfall will continue across much of western Maine and Seacoast New Hampshire through early afternoon before tapering off. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for a storm total of 9 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Significant snowfall near a foot of snow will bring a period of impacts. Moderate snow with periods of heavy snow will create hazardous travel conditions across the region. The combination of heavy wet snow and gusty winds will lead to snapped branches and a few downed trees. Scattered power outages likely.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
